tabs.title: Introduction
tabs.content:
Bringing nations together.

The Group of Twenty​ is an international forum for governments and central bank governors from 20 major economies to discuss and debate important global issues .

Emulating an annual summit of the same for the final round ( where a team of 3 represent each country’s President, Prime Minister and Governor of the Central bank), participants compete through two preliminary rounds to test their mettle in the finals. The reward for the winner, besides the opportunity to project yourself as a world leader, is a cash prize well worth the effort!

Whether you excel at English, or communication is your greatest strength, or you aspire to be a world leader, you know where to be in Kurukshetra’16!

tabs.title: Format
tabs.content:
ROUND 1:

Tests aptitude in basic world knowledge(ON SPOT).
​
ROUND 2​:

Showcasing strong teamwork and providing situational solutions (ONSPOT).

Here, you will be given a situation in a set timeline. The members can either enact the situation or formulate a solution for the given situation or report the situation. The creativity of the team will be judged here. Humour will be given extra points in this round.

ROUND 3:

A mock summit where the representing nations will present solutions.

To make their country a better place to live in (lots will be drawn after round 2 to represent countries,and one day preparation time will be given for round 3). 

Each country must submit a proposal on how to improve your current situation keeping in mind the country you have been assigned to. A detailed elaboration on each of your roles, the country's past situation and the country’s present must be discussed (examples including but not limited to Climate change, pollution, women empowerment,etc.). The relationships with other countries must also be mentioned here. Aids such as hard copy of documents / solution proposal or soft copy or ppts etc can be used. The audience and other countries will be allowed to question the solution statements and its practicality. Presentation, humour and proper analysis of your situation will be judged in this round.

Note: Each round is independent of the points from other round.

tabs.title: Rules
tabs.content:
» Teams should consist of exctly 3 members.

» The participants are requested to be dressed formally for Round 3.

tabs.title: Introduction
tabs.content:
‘Words are, in my not-so-humble opinion, our most inexhaustible source of magic.’

-Albus Dumbledore

Are you the grammar Nazi amongst your friends?

Think autocorrect is wasted on you?

Can’t control the urge to pounce on a typo?

This is an open call to everyone who’s too ‘grammar’-ous to be caught dead with a spelling mistake.


Disclaimer: Not for the weak-hearted or sesquipedalophobic.

tabs.title: Format
tabs.content:
ROUND 1:

This round will consist of two parts, a written part and a short list of words for dictation. Written part will consist of a series of word puzzles and questions to test vocabulary.

ROUND 2:

The final round will have the format of a typical gameshow. Score as much as you can in each sub-round and make it to the top. Each sub-round will have questions to test vocabulary, literary analysis and language skills.

tabs.title: Rules
tabs.content:
» Lone wolves only.

» All participants must have a valid k! ID to participate.

» Usage of electronic gadgets or Googling (or any other search engine) will lead to instant disqualification.

» The decisions taken by the organizers will be final and binding.

» Violation of any of the above rules will lead to instant disqualification.

tabs.title: Introduction
tabs.content:
"Pure mathematics is, in its way, the poetry of logical ideas."
-Albert Einstein    

                                                                                                                                    
Go down deep enough into anything and you will find Mathematics. k!16 brings to you Math Modelling with a completely new twist. Everything in life is a gamble, but as long as you have a chip in your hand, the game is not yet over.

Are all you math geeks out there ready to bet on your skills? Remember gambling is an addiction only if you are losing.

tabs.title: Format
tabs.content:
ROUND 1: The Paper Round

Questions based on mathematics and quantitative aptitude.

ROUND 2:

Level 1 - The Betting Round

Multiple choice mathematical questions where a bet is made on one of the choices.

Level 2 - The Bluff Round

The concerned team can either pass or claim to know the solution to the given question. If this claim is called a bluff by other teams, points will be awarded or deducted based on whether it is a bluff or not.

tabs.title: Rules
tabs.content:
» Each team can consist of only 2 members.

» The members of the team can be from different colleges/institutions.

» All participants must have a valid k! ID to take part in this event.

» The decisions of the organisers will be final and binding.

» Malpractices of any kind will lead to disqualification from the event.

tabs.title: Introduction
tabs.content:
"You get to Alcatraz by being the worst of the worst!”

-Gennifer Choldenko

 

Being a deadly criminal locked up in the tyrant prison of Alcatraz, do you think you have the lateral thinking ability to decipher the prison password and gain your freedom? Put your evil minds to use to experience the thrill of an adventure. Feel the adrenaline rush of your brain to swiftly solve puzzles and escape from the jail within an exhilarating 180 minutes!

tabs.title: Format
tabs.content:
ROUND 1: Written Round

Solve the logical mind teasers, puzzles and aptitude based questions.

ROUND 2: Task

Work your way around in completing tasks that test your presence of mind and applicative skills.

The difficulties range from moderate to tough.

ROUND 3: Prison Break

One of the wicked team members will be locked up inside the prison. The partners in crime should find the key to get him out, while the evil genius decrypts the location to find it.

CO-ORDINATE, COMMUNICATE AND ESCAPE!

tabs.title: Rules
tabs.content:
» Each team must consist of 3 or 4 members
» The participants need not be from the same institution/college
» All participants should have a valid k! ID.
» The decisions taken by the organizers will be the final and binding.
» k! IDs will be provided during the time of your registration. You will need your college ID card for this.

tabs.title: About ELGi
tabs.content:
ELGi Equipments Limited is a leading air compressor manufacturer with innovative and technologically superior compressed air systems. ELGi has earned worldwide distinction for designing sustainable solutions that help companies achieve their productivity goals.

The company’s portfolio of over 400 products has found wide application across industries. ELGi’s technology and manufacturing capabilities are home grown, and state of the art, enabling it to compete with global giants in the industry.

ELGi has strengthened its global presence with 100% acquisitions in France, Italy and the USA. ELGi has five wholly owned subsidiaries overseas and a joint venture with Sauer Gmbh of Germany.
